vectorLib
Class VectorProcessor

java.lang.Object
  vectorLib.VectorProcessor

public class VectorProcessor
extends java.lang.Object

Represents vector valued image. Value at each pixel in the image is a vector of floating point numbers.

Author:
Jarek Sacha

Nested Class Summary
 class VectorProcessor.Iterator
          Iterator over 3x3 neighborhood of vector valued pixels.
static class VectorProcessor.Neighborhood3x3
          Represents 3x3 neighborhood. the center pixel is p5.
 class VectorProcessor.PixelIterator
          Class that implements @link{java.util.Iterator} in order to create an Iterator that can iterate over the pixels.

Constructor Detail

VectorProcessor

public VectorProcessor(int width,
                       int height,
                       int numberOfValues)
Constructor that builds a VectorProcessor up given the width and height of the ROI and the number of stacked images from which it has been created. It gets called by the constructor that takes an ImageStack as parameter

Parameters:
width - the width of the image ROI
height - the height of the image ROI
numberOfValues - the depth of the stack from which it has been created i.e. the number of values (components, features) that describe each pixel

VectorProcessor

public VectorProcessor(ij.process.ColorProcessor cp)
Constructor that builds a VectorProcessor up given a @link{ColorProcessor} It calls the constructor @link{public VectorProcessor(final ImagePlus imp)} passing as parameters an empty string and the @link{ColorProcessor}

Parameters:
cp - the @link{ColorProcessor} used to build up the VectorProcessor

VectorProcessor

public VectorProcessor(ij.ImagePlus imp)
Constructor that builds a VectorProcessor up given an @link{ImagePlus} object It calls the constructor @link{public VectorProcessor(final ImageStack stack)} after converting the @link{ImagePlus} object into a @link{FloatProcessor}s stack

Parameters:
imp - the @link{ImagePlus} object used to get the stack

VectorProcessor

public VectorProcessor(ij.ImageStack stack)
Constructor that builds up a VectorProcessor froma a stack of FloatProcessors This is the constructor that is being used in @link{KMeans}

Parameters:
stack - a stack of FloatProcessors.

getNumberOfValues

Returns:
number of values at each pixel in the image.

getPixels

public float[][] getPixels()
Gives direct access to pixel values in the image. The first index is the pixel number (between 0 and width*height-1), the second index references within each pixel value.

Returns:
reference to the array containing pixel values in the image.

get

public float[] get(int x,
                   int y)
Return pixel value at coordinates (x, y). It calls @link{float[] get(final int x, final int y, float[] dest)} giving x, y as the first two parameters and null as the destination

Parameters:
x - x is the width
y - y is the height
Returns:
pixel value.

get

public float[] get(int x,
                   int y,
                   float[] dest)
Return pixel value at coordinates (x, y). Use dest to store the value.

Parameters:
x - x is the width
y - y is the height
dest - array to store pixel value, can be null. If null it wll be instantiated
Returns:
pixel value.

set

public void set(int x,
                int y,
                float[] v)
Set value of pixel value at coordinates (x, y).

Parameters:
x - x is the width
y - y is the height
v - is the pixel value (and array fo floating features)

duplicate

public VectorProcessor duplicate()
Duplicate method for the VectorProcessor class Calls the constructor @link{VectorProcessor(final int width, final int height, final int numberOfValues)}, then copies the pixel values

Returns:
and object that is the duplicate of the instance on which it is called
